intro: Spermacoce decandollei, commonly known as the purple rattlebox, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its showy, purple to violet flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds, typical of the genus Spermacoce. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
